value.title: We could see federal regulation on face recognition as early as next week

value.title: States move to limit government use of facial recognition software
value.excerpt: Kristina Partsinevelos joins 'The News with Shepard Smith' to discuss how different states are considering a full ban of facial recognition.

value.title: Amazon Halts Police's Use Of Facial Recognition Software: Reuters
value.excerpt: Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN) indefinitely extended the halt since June 2020 on the police use of its facial recognition software, Reuters reports. The nationwide backlash against police brutality towards non-Whites intensified by the murder of African-American George Floyd by a white policeman led to the initial halt.

value.title: Amazon extends ban of police using its facial recognition indefinitely
value.excerpt: Amazon Inc (NASDAQ:AMZN) barred police from using its facial-recognition software almost a year ago, saying it would prohibit them from using it for a year. Now the online retailer says it will extend the ban "until further notice.

value.title: New deep learning model brings image segmentation to edge devices

value.title: MIT Researchers Commercializing RFID and Computer Vision Robotics

value.title: A scientist from HSE University has developed an image recognition algorithm
value.excerpt: A scientist from HSE University has developed an image recognition algorithm that works 40% faster than analogues. It can speed up real-time processing of video-based image recognition systems. The results of the study have been published in the journal Information Sciences.

value.title: IBM's new 2-nm chips have transistors smaller than a strand of DNA
value.excerpt: In a shining example of the inexorable march of technology, IBM has unveiled new semiconductor chips with the smallest transistors ever made. The new 2-nanometer (nm) tech allows the company to cram a staggering 50 billion transistors onto a chip the size of a fingernail.
